intro: Cryosophila grayumii, commonly known as the grayumii snowbell, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-elevation areas of the Sierra Madre Occidental in Mexico. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant thrives in cold, moist environments and is adapted to survive in alpine conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Cryosophila grayumii is considered a vulnerable species.
